template<class T , void(T::*)(Thread *) Tmethod>
void lubyk::Thread::startThread ( T *  owner,
void *  parameter = NULL 
) [inline]

Start a new thread with the given parameter. The class should check if it should stop using a typical "while (thread->run())". If the thread is interrupted with a SIGTERM, the class's terminate() method is called.

Definition at line 98 of file thread.h.

References condition_, isRunning(), lubyk::Mutex::lock(), owner_, parameter, parameter_, should_run_, thread_id_, and lubyk::Condition::wait().

template<class T , void(T::*)() Tmethod>
void lubyk::Thread::startThread ( T *  owner,
void *  parameter = NULL 
) [inline]

Start a new thread with the given parameter. The class should check if it should stop using a typical "while (thread->run())". If the thread is interrupted with a SIGTERM, the class's terminate() method is called.

void lubyk::Thread::threadReady ( ) [inline]

This method should be called by started thread when it has properly started an it is ready. The creating thread locks until this method is called.
